message.content:
Research why CEP extensions get "EvalScript error" when debug mode IS enabled but ExtendScript still fails. Focus on:

1. What causes "EvalScript error" specifically in Adobe Premiere Pro CEP extensions
2. Common reasons why `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.X PlayerDebugMode 1` doesn't work
3. Alternative methods to enable CEP debug mode on macOS
4. Premiere Pro 2024/2025 specific requirements for CEP extensions
5. Any known issues with unsigned CEP extensions in recent Premiere Pro versions

Search the web for recent solutions (2024-2026) to this specific problem. Include any GitHub issues, Adobe forums, or Stack Overflow solutions.

input.query: CEP EvalScript error Adobe Premiere Pro 2024 2025 debug mode not working
PlayerDebugMode CEP extension not working macOS 2024 2025
unsigned CEP extension Premiere Pro 2024 2025 workaround

Based on the search results, here's what I found about CEP EvalScript errors in Adobe Premiere Pro 2024/2025 and debug mode issues:

## Common Causes and Solutions for CEP EvalScript Errors

### 1. Debug Mode Not Enabled for Correct CEP Version
The behavior described is "100% consistent with PlayerDebugMode not being enabled for the version of CEP in use by PPro."(no content)Different Premiere Pro versions use different CEP versions. PPro 24.x ships with CEP11, so you'd need to enable debug mode with: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11.plist PlayerDebugMode 1` (and then relaunch Finder on Mac).(no content)For Premiere Pro 2025, you need to make sure to enable debugging for CEP 12. Maybe the extension is only running on older Pr versions because debugging is only enabled for those older CEP versions.

### 2. JSX File Issues
"Be aware that with HTML Panels a typo in the JSX makes the whole thing fail silently." One solution was to remove the manifest reference to an empty jsx file, which made the panel function.(no content)Another user found "the log file mentioned a decode error. The solution was to save the file as utf8 rather than ascii."

### 3. New World Scripting in Newer Premiere Pro Versions
Version 14.0.2 and later defaults "New World" scripting to ON. #include directives don't work in New World. Instead, you can follow the usage in the PProPanel sample; upon panel launch, it evaluates (opens) all .jsx files used within the panel.

### 4. Debugging Recommendations
One developer reported having "set the PlayerDebugMode to 1 in Registry Editor" but still got "no proper error message, it just says EvalScript Error" and was unable to debug it.(no content)The recommended solution is to "Use Visual Studio Code (and the ExtendScript Debugger VSCode extension) to set breakpoints in PProPanel's ExtendScript, load the panel, and step through its code in the debugger."

### 5. Premiere Pro 2025 CEP Compatibility
Some users have found that plugins built on the CEP framework with Premiere Pro versions 22 to 24 do not run in Premiere Pro 2025.

### Debug Mode Commands by CEP Version:
- **CEP 11 (Premiere Pro 24.x)**: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11.plist PlayerDebugMode 1` (Mac)
- **CEP 12 (Premiere Pro 2025)**: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.12.plist PlayerDebugMode 1` (Mac)
- **Windows**: Set `PlayerDebugMode` to `1` in Registry under `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11` or `CSXS.12`


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about CEP EvalScript errors in Adobe Premiere Pro 2024/2025 and debug mode issues:

## Common Causes and Solutions for CEP EvalScript Errors

### 1. Debug Mode Not Enabled for Correct CEP Version
The behavior described is "100% consistent with PlayerDebugMode not being enabled for the version of CEP in use by PPro."(no content)Different Premiere Pro versions use different CEP versions. PPro 24.x ships with CEP11, so you'd need to enable debug mode with: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11.plist PlayerDebugMode 1` (and then relaunch Finder on Mac).(no content)For Premiere Pro 2025, you need to make sure to enable debugging for CEP 12. Maybe the extension is only running on older Pr versions because debugging is only enabled for those older CEP versions.

### 2. JSX File Issues
"Be aware that with HTML Panels a typo in the JSX makes the whole thing fail silently." One solution was to remove the manifest reference to an empty jsx file, which made the panel function.(no content)Another user found "the log file mentioned a decode error. The solution was to save the file as utf8 rather than ascii."

### 3. New World Scripting in Newer Premiere Pro Versions
Version 14.0.2 and later defaults "New World" scripting to ON. #include directives don't work in New World. Instead, you can follow the usage in the PProPanel sample; upon panel launch, it evaluates (opens) all .jsx files used within the panel.

### 4. Debugging Recommendations
One developer reported having "set the PlayerDebugMode to 1 in Registry Editor" but still got "no proper error message, it just says EvalScript Error" and was unable to debug it.(no content)The recommended solution is to "Use Visual Studio Code (and the ExtendScript Debugger VSCode extension) to set breakpoints in PProPanel's ExtendScript, load the panel, and step through its code in the debugger."

### 5. Premiere Pro 2025 CEP Compatibility
Some users have found that plugins built on the CEP framework with Premiere Pro versions 22 to 24 do not run in Premiere Pro 2025.

### Debug Mode Commands by CEP Version:
- **CEP 11 (Premiere Pro 24.x)**: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11.plist PlayerDebugMode 1` (Mac)
- **CEP 12 (Premiere Pro 2025)**: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.12.plist PlayerDebugMode 1` (Mac)
- **Windows**: Set `PlayerDebugMode` to `1` in Registry under `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11` or `CSXS.12`

Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/ReadMe.md"},{"title":"GitHub - Adobe-CEP/Samples: Code samples for CEP extensions","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about unsigned CEP extension workarounds for Premiere Pro 2024/2025:

## Key Workaround: PlayerDebugMode

PPro 25.0 integrates CEP12, so you'd need to set PlayerDebugMode again (for CEP12 instead of CEP11), in order to load unsigned extensions.

### For macOS:

Note: Premiere Pro 23.x integrates CEP11, so even if you had unsigned panels loading before (up to CEP10), you'll need to perform this step again, but for key CSXS.11. On MacOS, type the following into Terminal, then relaunch Finder (either via rebooting, or from the Force Quit dialog): `defaults write /Users/<username>/Library/Preferences/com.adobe.CSXS.12.plist PlayerDebugMode 1`(no content)Confirming (because it's bitten me before): You've restarted Finder, since enabling PlayerDebugMode, yes? We load unsigned panels in 25.x every day.

### For Windows:

On Windows, make the following registry entry (a new Key, of type String) - the key should be at `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.12` with a String value named `PlayerDebugMode` set to `1`.

### Extension Locations:

Put /PProPanel or your own panel's containing directory here, to have Premiere Pro load it: Windows: `C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions` Mac: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions`

### Important Notes:

1. Nothing has changed; PlayerDebugMode remains supported.

2. We figured out that there was a missing manifest element. Sorted! - If extensions still don't load, check your manifest file for missing elements.

3. I can confirm this is a huge issue across all Adobe 2025 apps at present. I've tried Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere Pro, Illustrator, and Audition. The name of the CEP panel displays, but no UI. - Some users have reported UI visibility issues.

### Future Considerations:

As of Premiere Pro 25.6, CEP extensions to Premiere Pro have been superseded by UXP Extensibility. If you are starting new development, start in UXP. CEP extensions continue to be supported; the plan is to support both CEP and UXP for a calendar year, after which we will remove support for CEP extensibilty.

### For Signing (if needed):

Please try the updated ZXP Sign Command tool: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/CEP-Resources/tree/master/ZXPSignCMD/4.1.3


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about PlayerDebugMode CEP extension issues on macOS in 2024-2025:

## Key Issues and Solutions

### 1. CEP Version Mismatch (Most Common Issue)
PPro 25.0 integrates CEP12, so you'd need to set PlayerDebugMode again (for CEP12 instead of CEP11), in order to load unsigned extensions.(no content)Setting the debug mode to the updated CEP version is the #1 reason that extensions stop working when a new CC version comes out.(no content)Users have reported that checking the logs made them notice there were logs for CSXS.12 and that they had to use that version instead of the one they had been using (CSXS.11).

### 2. How to Set PlayerDebugMode on macOS
For macOS, in the terminal, type: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1` (The plist is also located at /Users/`<username>`/Library/Preferences/com.adobe.CSXS.11.plist)

For **CEP 12** (Adobe 2025 apps), use:
```bash
defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.12 PlayerDebugMode 1
```

### 3. macOS Plist Caching Issue
Starting with Mac 10.9, Apple introduced a caching mechanism for plist files. Your modifications to plist files do not take effect until the cache gets updated (on a periodic basis, you cannot know exactly when the update will happen).

**Solutions:**
- Kill cfprefsd process. It will restart automatically. Then the update takes effect.
- Restart your Mac, or log out the current user and re-log in.
- Confirming (because it's bitten me before): You've restarted Finder, since enabling PlayerDebugMode, yes?

### 4. Blank Panel Issue (Adobe 2025 Apps)
If PlayerDebugMode is set to 1, extension panel will show up, but it will be blank. This was tested with multiple extensions including Watchtower, Chronicler, Excalibur, also Storyblocks and Adobe built-in extensions.(no content)This is a huge issue across all Adobe 2025 apps at present including Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere Pro, Illustrator, and Audition. The name of the CEP panel displays, but no UI.

### 5. Missing Manifest Element
One case was resolved when they figured out that there was a missing manifest element.

### 6. ZXPSignCmd Fix (April 2025)
As of 4/30/2025, Adobe fixed the issues for Windows and MacOS, and the updated ZXPSignCmd has been included in the latest release of vite-cep-plugin@1.2.9.

## Extension Locations on macOS
Extensions can be placed in:
- `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`
- `~/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about PlayerDebugMode CEP extension issues on macOS in 2024-2025:

## Key Issues and Solutions

### 1. CEP Version Mismatch (Most Common Issue)
PPro 25.0 integrates CEP12, so you'd need to set PlayerDebugMode again (for CEP12 instead of CEP11), in order to load unsigned extensions.(no content)Setting the debug mode to the updated CEP version is the #1 reason that extensions stop working when a new CC version comes out.(no content)Users have reported that checking the logs made them notice there were logs for CSXS.12 and that they had to use that version instead of the one they had been using (CSXS.11).

### 2. How to Set PlayerDebugMode on macOS
For macOS, in the terminal, type: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1` (The plist is also located at /Users/`<username>`/Library/Preferences/com.adobe.CSXS.11.plist)

For **CEP 12** (Adobe 2025 apps), use:
```bash
defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.12 PlayerDebugMode 1
```

### 3. macOS Plist Caching Issue
Starting with Mac 10.9, Apple introduced a caching mechanism for plist files. Your modifications to plist files do not take effect until the cache gets updated (on a periodic basis, you cannot know exactly when the update will happen).

**Solutions:**
- Kill cfprefsd process. It will restart automatically. Then the update takes effect.
- Restart your Mac, or log out the current user and re-log in.
- Confirming (because it's bitten me before): You've restarted Finder, since enabling PlayerDebugMode, yes?

### 4. Blank Panel Issue (Adobe 2025 Apps)
If PlayerDebugMode is set to 1, extension panel will show up, but it will be blank. This was tested with multiple extensions including Watchtower, Chronicler, Excalibur, also Storyblocks and Adobe built-in extensions.(no content)This is a huge issue across all Adobe 2025 apps at present including Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere Pro, Illustrator, and Audition. The name of the CEP panel displays, but no UI.

### 5. Missing Manifest Element
One case was resolved when they figured out that there was a missing manifest element.

### 6. ZXPSignCmd Fix (April 2025)
As of 4/30/2025, Adobe fixed the issues for Windows and MacOS, and the updated ZXPSignCmd has been included in the latest release of vite-cep-plugin@1.2.9.

## Extension Locations on macOS
Extensions can be placed in:
- `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`
- `~/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`

Based on the search results, here's what I found about the "Cannot Load Unsigned CEP 12 Extensions" issue on macOS 15 Sequoia with Premiere Pro:

## Problem Summary

Users reported being unable to load any unsigned CEP 12 extensions (custom panels or test panels) in Premiere Pro 2025 (version 25.2.3) on macOS Sequoia 15.1, despite correctly setting PlayerDebugMode as described in all Adobe documentation.

## The Fix

The issue was resolved in the Adobe Community thread. The team figured out that there was a missing manifest element, and the issue was marked as "Sorted!" and "Fixed."

## Key Steps to Enable Unsigned CEP 12 Extensions

1. **Set PlayerDebugMode for CEP 12**: Premiere Pro 25.0 integrates CEP12, so you'd need to set PlayerDebugMode again (for CEP12 instead of CEP11), in order to load unsigned extensions.

2. **Run the Terminal command**: On MacOS, type the following into Terminal, then relaunch Finder (either via rebooting, or from the Force Quit dialog):
   ```
   defaults write /Users/<username>/Library/Preferences/com.adobe.CSXS.12.plist PlayerDebugMode 1
   ```

3. **Important - Restart Finder**: Confirming (because it's bitten me before): You've restarted Finder, since enabling PlayerDebugMode, yes?

4. **Extension location**: Put your panel's containing directory in: Mac: /Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions (Note: That's the root /Library, not a specific user's ~/Library)

## Additional Notes

- Nothing has changed; PlayerDebugMode remains supported.
- As of Premiere Pro 25.6, CEP extensions to Premiere Pro have been superseded by UXP Extensibility. If you are starting new development, start in UXP. CEP extensions continue to be supported; the plan is to support both CEP and UXP for a calendar year, after which they will remove support for CEP extensibility.

If you're still experiencing issues after following these steps, the problem may be related to a missing manifest element in your extension, as was the case in the resolved bug report.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: "CEP ExtendScript "New World" scripting Premiere Pro evalscript error fix"

Links: [{"title":"Solved: EvalScript error on Premiere Pro 14.0.2 - Adobe Product Community - 10946333","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/evalscript-error-on-premiere-pro-14-0-2/td-p/10946333"},{"title":"New World scripting will be ON by default, in next Premiere Pro release!","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/new-world-scripting-will-be-on-by-default-in-next-premiere-pro-release/td-p/10883816"},{"title":"Solved: New World Scripting - Adobe Support Community - 10399121","url":"https://community.adobe.com:443/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/new-world-scripting/m-p/10399121"},{"title":"Re: New World scripting will be ON by default, in next Premiere Pro release!","url":"https://community.adobe.com:443/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/new-world-scripting-will-be-on-by-default-in-next-premiere-pro-release/m-p/10974456"},{"title":"Solved: ExtendScript & Premiere not working/connecting? pr... - Adobe Support Community - 10197372","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/extendscript-premiere-not-working-connecting-properly-newworld-no-quot-main-quot/m-p/10197372"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about the CEP ExtendScript "New World" scripting Premiere Pro evalScript error and how to fix it:

## The Problem

On CEP panels, any script run with `window.__adobe_cep__.evalScript()` gives "EvalScript error" after Premiere Pro was auto-upgraded to 14.0.2.(no content)As mentioned elsewhere, 14.0.2 defaults New World scripting to ON. `#include` directives don't work in New World.

## What is New World Scripting?

Premiere Pro is updating its internal script engine execution path. They're calling the existing ExtendScript engine through the same new "plumbing" being used by the more modern JavaScript engine, which will be used by UXP. The goal for this approach is that existing ExtendScript code should continue to work without modification under New World scripting.(no content)New World has been available since Premiere Pro 13.1.

## The Fix

Instead of using `#include` directives, you can follow the usage in the PProPanel sample (see /PProPanel/PProPanel.jsx); upon panel launch, it evaluates (opens) all .jsx files used within the panel.(no content)Some developers were using `#include` for importing json2.min.js since JSON is not available by default in ExtendScript. The solution is to change to `evalFile` to load json2.min.js at runtime on initialization with an absolute path.

## How to Test New World Compatibility

To enable New World for testing: Display the Console using `<ctrl>-<f12>` (Win) or `<cmd>-<f12>` (MacOS X), and use the 'hamburger' menu to access the Debug Database.

The testing process involves:
1. Launch host application
2. Confirm via Console window's Debug Database that New World is NOT enabled
3. Test your panel's ExtendScript - Your ExtendScript should work as it normally does(no content)4. Enable NewWorld (via instructions above)
5. Close and re-launch PPro
6. Confirm in Console that New World IS enabled
7. Test your panel's ExtendScript functionality again to see if it works correctly with New World enabled.

## Summary

The key takeaway is that **`#include` directives don't work with New World scripting**. You need to:
1. Replace `#include` with `evalFile()` calls
2. Load external .jsx files at runtime using absolute paths
3. Follow the PProPanel sample for proper implementation


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about CEP extension blank panel issues in Adobe 2025 and potential fixes/workarounds:

## CEP Extension Blank Panel Issues in Adobe 2025

### Known Issues

1. **Illustrator 2025 Blank Panels**: Every CEP panel opens blank in Illustrator 29.5, but they work fine in 29.4.(no content)It behaves as if PlayerDebugMode is set to 0, even when that's not the case.

2. **InDesign 2025 20.4 Breaking CEP Extensions**: InDesign 2025 20.4 apparently broke a lot of CEP extensions, including third-party extensions as well as Adobe's own standard CEP extensions.

3. **macOS + VM Issue**: Some users report signed extensions showing up in the menu but displaying a blank panel on Illustrator 2025 macOS, while 2024 on macOS and both versions on Windows work fine.(no content)This may be related to running macOS on a VM, with logs indicating inability to initialize "metal" or "MTL" - a GPU compatibility issue that only affects Illustrator 2025 due to changes in how panels are rendered.

### Fixes and Workarounds

1. **Update CSXS Version**: One user solved their issue by checking the logs and noticing there were logs for CSXS.12, requiring them to use that version instead of CSXS.11.

2. **Set PlayerDebugMode**: For unsigned extensions, add PlayerDebugMode = 1 in the registry under: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.12

3. **Downgrade (InDesign)**: For InDesign 2025 20.4 issues, the only known workaround was to downgrade to 20.0.

4. **Update to Latest Version (InDesign)**: The InDesign 20.4.1 update includes fixes for issues with CEP extensions. Users should try this version to see if it resolves the problems.

5. **Check Logs**: Check the logs for entries about what's causing the trouble. If using an unsigned extension that loaded on 29.4, nothing more should be needed to load it on 29.5, so logs are the first diagnostic step.

6. **Firewall Whitelisting**: You must whitelist each version of Adobe apps you use, including the Illustrator/Photoshop executable itself, CEPHtmlEngine.exe, and node.exe.

7. **CEP Still Works (Confirmation)**: CEP is still working in Illustrator 2025 (29.3.1). Setting PlayerDebugMode again may solve the problem.

### Note on CEP Support
There's some conflicting information about CEP support - one user reported that Adobe support confirmed CEP is no longer supported since Illustrator 2022, but other users confirmed CEP is still working in Illustrator 2025 (29.3.1).


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about CEP extension blank panel issues in Adobe 2025 and potential fixes/workarounds:

## CEP Extension Blank Panel Issues in Adobe 2025

### Known Issues

1. **Illustrator 2025 Blank Panels**: Every CEP panel opens blank in Illustrator 29.5, but they work fine in 29.4.(no content)It behaves as if PlayerDebugMode is set to 0, even when that's not the case.

2. **InDesign 2025 20.4 Breaking CEP Extensions**: InDesign 2025 20.4 apparently broke a lot of CEP extensions, including third-party extensions as well as Adobe's own standard CEP extensions.

3. **macOS + VM Issue**: Some users report signed extensions showing up in the menu but displaying a blank panel on Illustrator 2025 macOS, while 2024 on macOS and both versions on Windows work fine.(no content)This may be related to running macOS on a VM, with logs indicating inability to initialize "metal" or "MTL" - a GPU compatibility issue that only affects Illustrator 2025 due to changes in how panels are rendered.

### Fixes and Workarounds

1. **Update CSXS Version**: One user solved their issue by checking the logs and noticing there were logs for CSXS.12, requiring them to use that version instead of CSXS.11.

2. **Set PlayerDebugMode**: For unsigned extensions, add PlayerDebugMode = 1 in the registry under: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.12

3. **Downgrade (InDesign)**: For InDesign 2025 20.4 issues, the only known workaround was to downgrade to 20.0.

4. **Update to Latest Version (InDesign)**: The InDesign 20.4.1 update includes fixes for issues with CEP extensions. Users should try this version to see if it resolves the problems.

5. **Check Logs**: Check the logs for entries about what's causing the trouble. If using an unsigned extension that loaded on 29.4, nothing more should be needed to load it on 29.5, so logs are the first diagnostic step.

6. **Firewall Whitelisting**: You must whitelist each version of Adobe apps you use, including the Illustrator/Photoshop executable itself, CEPHtmlEngine.exe, and node.exe.

7. **CEP Still Works (Confirmation)**: CEP is still working in Illustrator 2025 (29.3.1). Setting PlayerDebugMode again may solve the problem.

### Note on CEP Support
There's some conflicting information about CEP support - one user reported that Adobe support confirmed CEP is no longer supported since Illustrator 2022, but other users confirmed CEP is still working in Illustrator 2025 (29.3.1).

content.text:
Based on my research, here is a comprehensive summary of CEP "EvalScript error" issues and solutions for Adobe Premiere Pro:

---

## CEP "EvalScript Error" Causes and Solutions

### 1. CEP Version Mismatch (Most Common Cause)

The error is "100% consistent with PlayerDebugMode not being enabled for the version of CEP in use by PPro."

| Premiere Pro Version | CEP Version | Command |
|---------------------|-------------|---------|
| PPro 2024 (24.x) | CEP 11 | `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1` |
| PPro 2025 (25.x) | CEP 12 | `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.12 PlayerDebugMode 1` |

**Critical step**: After running the command, you MUST restart Finder (reboot or Force Quit Finder).

Source: [Adobe CEP Samples Issue #133](https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/issues/133)

---

### 2. macOS Plist Caching Issue

Starting with macOS 10.9, Apple introduced a caching mechanism for plist files. Modifications do not take effect until the cache updates.

**Solutions:**
- Kill `cfprefsd` process (it restarts automatically)
- Log out and log back in
- Reboot the Mac

Source: [Creative-Scripts CEP Debug Guide](https://creative-scripts.com/setting-cep-debug-and-log-level/)

---

### 3. New World Scripting (PPro 14.0.2+)

Premiere Pro 14.0.2 and later defaults "New World" scripting to ON. **#include directives do not work in New World.**

**Fix**: Replace `#include` with `evalFile()` calls at runtime:
```javascript
// Instead of: #include "json2.min.js"
// Use:
var scriptPath = $.fileName.split('/').slice(0, -1).join('/');
$.evalFile(scriptPath + '/json2.min.js');
```

Source: [EvalScript error on Premiere Pro 14.0.2](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/evalscript-error-on-premiere-pro-14-0-2/td-p/10946333)

---

### 4. JSX File Errors Fail Silently

A typo or encoding error in JSX makes the whole thing fail silently with just "EvalScript error."

**Fixes:**
- Save JSX files as UTF-8 (not ASCII)
- Remove manifest references to empty JSX files
- Use VS Code with ExtendScript Debugger extension to debug

Source: [CEP hello world returns EvalScript error](https://community.adobe.com/t5/after-effects/cep-hello-world-returns-quot-evalscript-error-quot/m-p/9366081)

---

### 5. macOS 15 Sequoia + CEP 12 Issue (Fixed)

There was a known issue with unsigned CEP 12 extensions on macOS 15 Sequoia where PlayerDebugMode was ignored. This was marked as **Fixed** by Adobe.

The resolution involved a missing manifest element. Ensure your manifest.xml is complete.

Source: [Cannot Load Unsigned CEP 12 Extensions - Fixed](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-bugs/cannot-load-unsigned-cep-12-extensions-in-premiere-pro-25-on-macos-15-playerdebugmode-ignored/idc-p/15333640)

---

### 6. Blank Panel Issue (Adobe 2025 Apps)

Some users report the panel name displays but UI is blank. This affects multiple Adobe 2025 apps.

**Potential fixes:**
- Update to latest version of the Adobe app
- Check logs at `~/Library/Logs/CSXS/`
- Verify GPU/Metal compatibility (especially on VMs)

Source: [CEP Panels won't load in Illustrator 29.5](https://community.adobe.com/t5/illustrator-discussions/cep-panels-won-t-load-in-illustrator-29-5/m-p/15300613)

---

## Complete Debug Mode Setup for macOS

```bash
# For Premiere Pro 2024 (CEP 11)
defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1

# For Premiere Pro 2025 (CEP 12)
defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.12 PlayerDebugMode 1

# Kill plist cache daemon to force update
killall cfprefsd

# Restart Finder
killall Finder
```

---

## Extension Locations

- **System-wide**: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`
- **User-specific**: `~/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`

---

## Important: CEP Deprecation Notice

As of Premiere Pro 25.6, CEP extensions have been superseded by UXP Extensibility. Adobe plans to support both CEP and UXP for a calendar year, after which CEP support will be removed.

Source: [PProPanel ReadMe](https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/ReadMe.md)

---

## Debugging Recommendations

1. Use VS Code with [ExtendScript Debugger extension](https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Getting-Started-guides/blob/master/Client-side%20Debugging/readme.md)
2. Check CSXS logs at `~/Library/Logs/CSXS/`
3. Use Premiere Pro's Debug Console (`Cmd+F12`) to verify New World scripting status
4. For signing issues, use updated [ZXPSignCmd 4.1.3](https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/CEP-Resources/tree/master/ZXPSignCMD/4.1.3) (fixed April 2025)
